data.title: Capet, Part 9
data.text:
King João I of Portugal (see Part 8) had issue:

1a) Branca (Lisbon13 Jul 1388-Lisbon Mar 1389; bur Lisbon cathedral)

2a) Affonso (Santarem30 Jul 1390-Braga22 Dec 1400; bur Braga Cathedral)

3a) Duarte I, 1433 King of Portugal and the Algarve (Viseu 31 Oct 1391-Thomar9 Sep 1438; bur Batalla); m.Coimbra 4 Nov 1428 Leonora (ca 1400-Toledo 19 Feb 1445; bur Batalla 1456), dau of King Fernando I of Aragón

1b) João (Lisbon Oct 1429, d.by 1433; bur Batalla)

2b) Filippa (Santarem27 Nov 1430-d.Lisbon of the plague 24 Mar 1439; bur Batalla)

3b) Affonso V, 1438 King of Portugal and the algarve, King of Cueta, 1475/9 titular King of Castile (Sintra 15 Jan 1432-d.Sintra of the plague 28 Aug 1481); m.6 May 1448 Isabella of Portugal (1432-1455; below); he is sometimes said to have m.2nd Placentia 23/30 May 1475 (div 1479) Juana “Beltraneja” of Castile (1459-Coimbra 1506), but this marriage probably never took place

1c) João (b.Sintra 29 Jan 1451, d.by 1455; bur Batalla)

2c) Joana, Regent of Portugal 1471/5; beatified 1693 (Lisbon6 Feb 1452-Aveiro12 May 1490)

3c) João II "the Severe", 1481 King of Portugal and the Algarve (Lisbon3 May 1455-Alvora25 Oct 1495; bur Batalla); m.Setúbal 22 Jan 1471 Infta Leonor of Portugal (1458-1525; below)

1d) Affonso (Lisbon18 May 1475-nrSantarem13 Jul 1491; bur Batalla); m.by proxy at Seville11 Apr 1490 and in person at Estremos 24 Nov 1490 Isabella of Aragon and Castile (Duenas 2 Oct 1470-Saragossa 24/25 Aug 1498), later wife of King Manoel of Portugal

2d) João (b.and d.Feb/Mar 1483)

3d) [by Anna Mendoza] Jorge de Lancastre, Duque de Coimbra, Grand Admiral of Portugal, b.Abrantes 1481, d.Setubal 1550, bur Cestele de Palmela; m.1500 Britez de Portugal-Villena-Melo (1483-1535)

1e) João de Lancastre, Duque de Aveiro (1501-1571, bur Coimbra); m.Almerim 1547 Juliana de Lara y Menezes à issue

2e) Affonso de Lancastre, d.1578; m.Violante Henriquez e Coutinho à issue, including the Duques de Abrantes and Aveiro

3e) Luiz de Lancastre, Grand Commander of the Order of Aviz, d.1574, bur Setubal; m.1540 Magdalena de Granada à issue

4e) Jaime, a priest

5e) Elena, a nun

6e) Filippa, a nun

7e) Maria, a nun

8e) Isabel, a nun

9e) [illegtimate] Jorge, d.after 1612

10e) [illegtimate] Jorge, a monk

11e) [illegtimate] Joana, a nun

12e) [illegtimate] Jorge, Bp of Leiria, d.there 1623

4b) Maria (Sardoal 7 Dec 1432-8 Dec 1432; bur Batalla)

5b) Leonor (Torres Novas Vedras 18 Sep 1434-Wiener Neustadt 3 Sep 1467; bur Vienna); m.by proxy 9 Aug 1451 and in person at Rome 16 Mar 1452 Emperor Friedrich III (d.19 Aug 1493)

6b) Fernando, Duque de Beja, de Salvaterra e de Viseu (Almeirim 17 Nov 1433-Setúbal18 Sep 1470; bur Sta.Maria Concepçao, Beja); m.Alcoçovas 16 Mar 1452 Brites of Portugal (1430-1506; below)

1c) João, Duque de Beja e de Viseu (ca 1456-1483)

2c) Leonor (Beja 2 May 1458-Lisbon17 Nov 1525; bur Xabregas); m.Setúbal 22 Jan 1471 King João II of Portugal (see above)

3c) Isabella (1459-Apr 1521; bur Lisbon); m.19 Sep 1472 Fernando, Duque de Bragança (d.21 Jun 1485)

4c) Diego, Duque de Beja e de Viseu (b.1460, stabbed to death at Setúbal 23 Aug 1484; bur Batalla)

1d) [illegitimate] Alfosno, legitimized, Duque de Viseu (ca 1484-Oct 1504); m.2 Jun 1500 Joana de Noronha

1e) Brites de Portugal-Lara Marquesa de Villa-Real, b.ca 1503, d.after 1520; m.Dec 1519 Pedro de Menezes Marques de Villa-Real, etc

5c) Duarte (b.ca 1462, d.young)

6c) Diniz (b.ca 1464, d.young; bur Beja)

7c) Catarina (b.ca 1465, d.young)

8c) Simião (b.ca 1467, d.young; bur Beja)

9c) Affonso (b.ca 1468, d.young; bur Beja)

10c) Manoel I, 1495 King of Portugal and the Algarve, 1484 Duque de Beja e de Viseu, etc (Alcocheta 1 Jun 1469-d.Lisbon of the plague 13 Dec 1521; bur Belem); m.1st Valencia d'Alcantara Oct 1497 Isabella of Aragon and Castile, Pss of the Asturias (Duenas 2 Oct 1470-Saragossa 24/25 Aug 1498; bur Toledo), widow of Afonso of Portugal (above); m.2nd by proxy at Lisbon 24 Aug 1500 1nd in person at Alcacer-de-Sal 30 Oct 1500 Maria of Aragon and Castile (Cordoba 29 Jun 1482-Lisbon 7 Mar 1517; bur Belem); m.3rd Lisbon 7 Mar 1519 Eleonora of Spain (Brussels 15 Nov 1498-Talavera 18 Feb 1558; bur Escorial), later wife of King François I of France

1d) Miguel da Paz, Pr of Portugal, Pr of the Asturias [as heir presumptive to Spain] (Saragossa23 Aug 1498-Granada19 Jul 1500; bur Saragossa)

2d) João III, 1521 King of Portugal and the Algarve (Lisbon6 Jun 1502-Lisbon11 Jun 1557; bur Belem); m.Salamanca 5 Feb 1525 Catarina (Torquemada 14 Jan 1507-Lisbon12 Feb 1578; bur Belem), dau of King Felipe I of Spain

1e) Affonso (Almeria24 Feb 1526-Mar/Apr 1526; bur Belem)

2e) Maria (Coimbra15 Oct 1527-Valladolid12 Jul 1545; bur Escorial); m.Almeria 15 Nov 1543 King Felipe II of Spain (d.13 Sep 1598)

3e) Isabella (Lisbon28 Apr 1529-1530; bur Belem)

4e) Brites (Lisbon15 Feb 1530-1530; bur Belem)

5e) Manoel (Alvito 1 Nov 1531-Evora14 Apr 1537; bur Belem)

6e) Filippe (Evora 25 May 1533-Evora29 Apr 1539; bur Belem)

7e) Diniz (Evora 26 Apr 1535-Evora1 Jan 1539; bur Belem)

8e) João (Evora 3 Jun 1537-Lisbon2 Jan 1554; bur Belem); m.Toro 7 Dec 1552 Juana (Madrid27 Jun 1537-Escorial7 Sep 1573; bur Madrid), dau of Emperor Karl V, King of Spain

1f) Sebastião, 1557 King of Portugal and the Algarve (Lisbon20 Jan 1554-k.a.in a naval battle nr Alcacer 4 Aug 1578; bur Belem)

9e) Antonio (Lisbon9 Mar 1539-Lisbon20 Jan 1540; bur Belem)

10e) [by Isabel Muniz] Manoel de Portugal, d.young

11e) [by Isabel Muniz] Duarte de Portugal, Archbishop of Braga and Evora (1521-Lisbon 11 Nov 1543)

3d) Isabella (Lisbon4 Oct 1503-Toledo1 May 1539; bur Escorial); m.Seville 11 Mar 1526 Emperor Charles V, King of Spain (d.21 Sep 1558)

4d) Maria Brites, Cts d'Asti (Lisbon 31 Dec 1504-Nice 8 Jan 1538); m.Villefranche 29 Sep 1520 Duke Charles III of Savoy (d.17 Aug 1553)

5d) Luiz, 1527 Duque de Beja (Abrantes 3 Mar 1506-Quinta de Marvilla 27 Nov 1555; bur Belem)

1e) [by Violanta "la Pelicana" Gomez, born a Jew, d.as a nun at Almorta] Antonio de Portugal (Lisbon 1531-Paris 26 Aug 1595; bur Paris); recognized by England and other powers as King of Portugal in 1580; he and his descendants, known as "the Portuguese Princes", were political pawns for the next few decades as Spain conquered Portugal and the powers threatened to restore these princes; he had natural issue by Anna Barbosa:

1f) Manoel, "Prince" de Portugal (Tangier 1568-Brussels 22 Jun 1638; bur Brussels); m.1st The Hague 17 Nov 1597 Pss Emilia of Orange-Nassau (Köln 10 Apr 1569-Geneva16 Mar 1629; bur St.Pierre, Geneva); m.2nd Brussels3 Apr 1630 Luisa Osorio (d.after 1645)

1g) Maria Belgica (Delft 1599-Genoa 29 Jun 1647; bur St.Pierre, Geneva); m.Prangins Jun 1629 Johann Theodor de Croll, Baron de Prangins (k.a.Venice 1647)

2g) Manoel, Gov of Orange and Steenwijck (Delft 1600-Schagen 27 Oct 1660); m.1646 Johanna Gfn von Hanau-Münzenberg (1610-1673)

1h) Wilhelmina Amalia (b.1647, d.young)

2h) Elisabeth Maria, "Dss de Beira, Css de Manalva" (20 Nov 1648-15 Oct 1717); m.11 Apr 1678 Baron Adrian van Gendt (d.after 1720)

3h) Amalia Maria Luisa (Dec 1649-Bergen-op-Zoom 8 Jul 1731)

4h) Christina Delfica (b.15 Dec 1650, d.young)

3g) Louis William Christoph, Marques de Trancoso (Rotterdam 1601-Brussels 7 Jul 1660); m.Naples 1631 Anna Maria di Capece-Galeoti, dau of Giambattista Capece-Galeoti Pr di Monteleone

1h) Manoel, Marques de Trancoso, Cde de Sandim (1633-Rome 16 Sep 1687)

2h) Fernando Alexander, Marquez de Trancoso, Cde de Sandim, Abbot of St.Bernard, Antwerp (1634-Brussels 24 Dec 1668)

4g) Juliane Katharine (1603-Delft 22 Jul 1680)

5g) Emilia Luise (Delft 1605-Delft 29 Oct 1670); m. ____

6g) Anna Frisia Luise (1606-5 Apr 1669); m. ____

7g) Mauritia Eleonora (Delft 1609-Bergen-op-Zoom 16 Jun 1674); m.The Hague 4 Jun 1647 Georg Friedrich Fst von Nassau-Siegen (d.2 Oct 1674)

8g) Sabine Dorothea (1610-20 Jul 1670)

2f) Christovao, a Prior in the Knights of Malta (Tangier Apr 1573-Paris 3 Jun 1638, bur Paris)

3f) Pedro, a monk

4f) Dinis, a monk

5f) Afonso, d.Naples ____

6f) João, d.young

7f) Filippa, a nun, d.Avila

8f) Luisa, a nun at Tordesillas

9f) Violante, a nun in Burgos, d.after 1602

10f) Antonia, a nun in Burgos, d.after 1602

6d) Fernando, 1530 Duque de Guarda (Abrantes 5 Jun 1507-Abrantes7 Nov 1534; bur Belem); m.Mar 1530 Guyomare de Coutinho, Cdsa de Marialva e Loulé (d.Abrantes 9 Dec 1534; bur Abrantes), dau of Francesco de Coutinho, Cde de Loulé

1e) a son (ca 1533-Abrantes 3 Oct 1534)

2e) Luiza (ca 1531-Abrantes 1 Aug 1534)

7d) Affonso, Cardinal 1517/8, Archbishop of Lisbon 1523 (Evora 23 Apr 1509-Lisbon21 Apr 1540; bur Lisbon Cathedral)

8d) Henrique, 1578 King of Portugal and the Algarve; 1562/8 Regent of Portugal; formerly a Cardinal from 1545, Archbishop of Lisbon 1564 (Lisbon31 Jan 1512-Almeria31 Jan 1580; bur Belem)

9d) Maria (b.and d.Evora 1513; bur Belem)

10d) Duarte, 1537 Duque de Guimaraes (Lisbon7 Sep 1515-Lisbon20 Oct 1540); m.Villa Viçosa 23 Apr 1537 Isabella de Bragança (ca 1512-Villa Viçosa 16 Sep 1576; below)

1e) Maria (Lisbon8 Dec 1538-Parma18 Jul 1577; bur Parma); m. Brussels Nov 1565 Alessandro Farnese, Duke of Parma (d.15 Dec 1592)

2e) Catarina (Lisbon18 Jan 1540-Villa Viçosa 15 Nov 1614); m.Villa Viçosa 8 Dec 1563 João, Duque de Bragança (d.1583; below)

3e) Duarte, 1541 Duque de Guimaraes (Almeirim Mar 1541-Evora 28 Nov 1576; bur Evora)

11d) Antonio (b.and d.Lisbon 9 Sep 1516; bur Belem)

12d) Carlos (Evora 18 Feb 1520-Lisbon15 Apr 1521; bur Belem)

13d) Maria, sna de Viseu, etc (Lisbon8 Jun 1521-Lisbon10 Oct 1577; bur Lisbon)

7b) Duarte (Alenquer 12 Jul 1435-1435)

8b) Catarina, a nun (Lisbon26 Nov 1436-Lisbon17 Jun 1463; bur St.Eloy, Lisbon)

9b) Joana (Monte Oliveto Mar 1439-Madrid 13 Jun 1475; bur San Francisco, Madrid); m.Cordoba 21 May 1455 King Enrique IV of Castile (d.12 Dec 1474); she had illegitimate issue with Pedro de Castilla

10b) [by Juana Manuel, dau.of Fernando Manuel de la Torre, sn de Cebica] João Manoel, Bp of Ceuta and Guarda, Primate of Africa, d.1476/88; he had illegitimate issue by Justa Rodriguez Pereira:

1c) João Manoel, hereditary Grand Alcalde of Santarem, d.after 1500; m.Isabel, dau.of Affonso Tellez de Menezes

1d) Bernardo, d.Naples after 1520; m.1st Francisca de Noronha de Castello-Branco; m.2nd Maria de Bobadilha de Saldanha

[by 1st m.]:

1e) Mecia Manoel de Noronha; m.Pedro de Menezes, sn de Fermozelha

2e) Joana, a nun in Lisbon

[by 2d m.]:

3e) João, d.in India 1546

4e) Leonor, d.young

5e) Antonio, Commander of the Order of Santiago, d.after 9 Sep 1538; m.Brites Mexia

6e) Tristao; m.Margarida de Almeida

1f) Antonio, went to India 1586; m.Maria N

2f) Maria; m.1st Francisco de Agular; m.2nd Francisco de Sylveira

2d) Joana; m.Affonso Pacheco Portocarrero, sn de Moguere

2c) Nunho Manoel, sn de Salvaterra, das Aguias e Erra d.1520/8; m.1st Leonor de Mila; m.2nd 1519 Lourenca de Ataide; he left issue, surnamed "Manoel":

1d) Fradique, sn de Atalaya, etc, d.after 22 Sep 1542; m.Maria de Ataide

1e) Nuno II, sn de Atalaya, etc, d.1578/82; m.Joana de Ataide

1f) Fradique, k.a.Alcacer 1578

2f) Francisco, Cde de Atalaya, d.1624; m.ca 1604 Iria de Brito

1g) Nuno, b.1605/6, d.1619 of a fall from a horse

3f) Antonio, d.in India 1600

4f) Pedro, Cde de Atalaya, Viceroy of the Algarve, d.Madrid 1628; m.Maria de Ataide de Menezes à issue

5f) João, Archbishop of Lisbon, Viceroy of Portugal, d.Lisbon 1633, bur there

6f) Francisca; m.Manoel Mascarenhas, sn de Gocharia

7f) Maria, an Abbess

8f) Madalena, a nun

9f) Catarina, a nun

10f) Ana, a nun

11f) Eufrasia, a nun

12f) Violante, Abbess of Villa-Longa

2e) João, k.a.Alcacer 1578; m.1st Iria de Sequeira; m.2nd Brites de Abrantes Passanha

1f) Valentim, a monk

2f) Antonio "the Hollander", Captain of Malacca, d.after 1605; m.Francisca de Lacerda-Pereira à issue

3f) João Francisco, k.a.Alcacer 1578

4f) Isabel; m.Constantino de Magalhaens, sn da Ponte de Barca

5f) Ana, a nun

6f) Maria, a nun

3e) Diego, Grand Prior of the Order of Santiago

4e) Alvaro, d.India after 1562

5e) Manoel

6e) Leonor, m.Luiz Carneiro, sn de Ilha do Principe

7e) Ana

2d) João; m.1st Leonor de Vilhena da Sylveira; m.2d Maria de Noronhal he had ilelgitimate issue:

1e) Jorge, k.a.Alcacer 1578

2e) Tristao

3e) Jeronyma, a nun

4e) Maria; m.Pedro Pessoa

3d) Francisco, Gov of Piombino

1e) Felix

4d) Jorge; m.Leonor de Brito

1e) Pedro, d.in India

2e) Estevao, k.a.Alcacer 1578

3e) Jeronymo; m.Maria de Mendoca Barreto, heiress of the Albuquerque estates

1f) Jorge, sn de Albuquerque, Cde de Lavadio; m.Tereza Coutinho da Gama à issue

2f) Lourenco

3f) Antonia; m.Pedro de Mendoca

4f) [illegitimate]Jorge, a priest

5f) [illegitimate]Jeronymo, d.in India; m.N Carvalho à issue

4e) Antonio

5e) Maria; m.Henrique Enriquez de castilla, sn de Alcacovas

6e) Violante, a nun

7e) Jeronyma, a nun

8e) Ana, a nun

9e) Madalena, a nun

10e) Antonia; m.Pedro de Mendoca

11e) Catarina, d.young

5d) Affonso; m. NN

1e) Jeronymo, k.a.Alcacer 1578

1f) [illegitimate]Tristao, d.in India

1g) [illegitimate]Antonio, d.in India after 1598

2e) Maria; m.Pedro Lopes Girao de Santarem

3e) Catarina, a nun

6d) Leonor; m.Nuno Rodriguez Barreto

7d) Maria; m.Alvaro de Cordova

8d) Joana; m.Ruy Barreto de Melo, sn de Quarteira

4a) Pedro, 1415 Duque de Coimbra, 1439/46 Regent of Portugal (Lisbon9 Dec 1392-k.a.on the banks of the Alfarobeia 20 May 1449; bur Batalla); m.Coimbra 13 Sep 1428 Isabel (1409-1443; bur Batalla), dau of Jaime de Aragón, Cde de Urgel

1b) Pedro, pretender to the Aragonese throne 1465/6 (1429-k.a.Granollers 30 Jun 1466; bur Sta Maria, Barcelona)

2b) João, 1449 Duque de Coimbra, 1456 Regent of Cyprus, Pr of Antioch (ca 1431-d.of p[oisoning by his mother-in-law 7 Oct 1457); m.1456 Charlotte de Lusignan, Queen of Cyprus (Nicosia 1442-Rome 16 Jul 1487)

3b) Isabella (1432-Evora 2 Dec 1455; bur Batalla); m.6 May 1448 King Affonso V of Portugal (d.1481; above)

4b) Jaime, Cardinal, Archbishop of Lisbon 1453 (16 Sep 1434-Florence15 Apr 1459; bur S.Miniar, Florence)

5b) Brites (1435-Bruges Feb 1462; bur Quesnoy); m.13 May 1453 Adolf of Cleves-Ravenstein (d.18 Sep 1492)

6b) Filippa, a nun (Coimbra 1437-Odivellas 25 Jul 1497; bur Odivellas)

5a) Henrique "the Navigator", Duque de Viseu (Oporto4 Mar 1394-Sagres13 Nov 1460; bur Batalla)

6a) Isabella (Evora 21 Feb 1397-Nieppe17 Dec 1472; bur Dijon); m.by proxy at Lisbon24 Jul 1429 and in person at Bruges 7/10 Jan 1430 Philippe III, Duc de Bourgogne (d.15 Jun 1467)

7a) Branca (b.1398, d.young)

8a) João (Santarem13 Jan 1400-Alcacer-de-Sal18 Oct 1442;bur Batalla); m.11 Nov 1424 his niece, Isabella de Bragança (1402-1465; below)

1b) Diego (ca 1426-1443; bur Batalla)

2b) Isabella (ca 1428-Arévalo 15 Aug 1496; bur Miraflora nr Burgos); m.Madrigalejo Aug 1447 King Juan II of Castile (d.21 Jul 1454)

3b) Brites (ca 1430-Beja 30 Sep 1506; bur Sta Maria, Beja); m.Alcaçovas 16 Mar 1452 Fernando of Portugal, Duque de Viseu (d.1470; above)

4b) Filippa, sna de Villa de Almada (ca 1432-ca 1444)

9a) Fernando "the Blessed" (Santarem29 Sep 1402-k.a.Fez5 Jun 1433; bur Batalla)

10a) [by Inez Perez Esteves] Affonso de Portugal, 1391 Cde de Neiva, 1401 Cde de Barcelos, de Faria e Penafiel, 1422 Cde de Ourem e Arrayolos, 1442 Duque de Bragança, legitimized 1401 (ca 1377-Chaves Dec 1461; bur Chaves); m.1st Leyria 8 Nov 1401 Brites de Pereira, Cdsa de Barcellos, Ourem e de Arrayolos (ca 1380-Lisbon ca 1412), dau of Nuno Alvarez Pereira, Cde de Barcellos; m.2nd Sintra 23 Jul 1420 Costança "the Pious" de Castilla (d.Guimaraes 26 Jan 1480; bur San Francisco, Guimaraes), dau of Alfonso de Castilla Cde de Gijón by Isaballa de Portugal

1b) Isabella (Oct 1402-Arevalo 26 Oct 1465; bur Batalla); m.11 Nov 1424 her uncle, João of Portugal (d.1442; above)

2b) Affonso, 1422 Cde de Ourem, 1451 Marques de Valencia (ca 1403-Tomar 29 Aug 1460)

1c) [illegitimate] Alfonso de Portugal, Bp of Evora (1440-1522); he had illegitimate issue by Filippa de Macedo:

1d) Francisco I Luiz de Portugal, legitimized 1505, Cde de Vimioso, b.1480, d.Evora 1549, bur there; m.1st ca 1506 Brites de Vilhena de Menezes (d.1515); m.2nd 1516 Joana de Vilhena de Mello-Portugal (1486-1559)

1e) Affonso I, Cde de Vimioso, b.1519, d.Africa 1579; m.1549 Luiza de Guzman

1f) Francisco II, Cde de Vimioso, b.1550, k.a.nr the Azores 1582, bur there

2f) Alvaro, d.Naples before 1582

3f) João, Bp of Viseu, d.1639

4f) Manoel, k.a.Alcacer 1578

5f) Luiz I, Cde de Vimioso, b.1555, d.Evora 1637, bur there; m.ca 1590 Joana de Mendoca de Castro (1563-1643) à issue

6f) Nuno Alvares, d.after 1625; m.Joana de Portugal, sna de Val de Palma à issue

7f) Filippa, a nun

8f) Maria, a nun

9f) Costanca, a nun

10f) Filippa, a nun

11f) Joana, Prioress in Evora, d.after 23 Dec 1614

12f) Estefania, a nun

13f) Jeronyma, a nun

14f) Guiomar

15f) Vicenca

16f) Margarida

2e) João, Bp of Guarda, b.Evora 1520, d.1592

3e) Manoel, b.1522, d.Lisbon 1606, bur there; m.1st Maria de Menezes; m.2nd Margarida de Mendoca Corte Real, sna de Val de Palma à issue

4e) Guiomar (1508-1585, bur Vidigueira); m.Francisco de Gama, Cde de Vidigueira

2d) Martinho, Archbishop of Funchal, d.Lisbon 1547, bur there; he had illegitimate issue by Catarina de Sousa:

1e) Eliseo, d.Madrid 1590

2e) Maria Cecilia; m.Rodrigo Diogo de Castro

3d) Brites, d.after 26 Jun 1530

3b) Fernando I, 1461 Duque de Bragança, 1455 Marques de Villa Viçosa, 1460 Marques de Valencia, 1461 Cde de Barcellos, Cde de Ourem, Arrayolos, Neiva, Penafiel e Faria, sn de Guimaraes e Monforte, Gov of Ceuta (1404-Villa Viçosa 1 Apr 1478; bur Villa Viçosa); m.28 Dec 1429 Joana de Castro, sna de Cadaval (ca 1407-Lisbon 14 Feb 1479; bur Lisbon), dau of João de Castro, sn de Cadaval

1c) Fernando II "the African", 1470 Cde e Duque de Guimaraes, 1478 Duque de Bragança, etc (1430-executed at Evora 21 Jun 1483; bur Villa Viçosa); m.1st 1447 Leonor de Menezes (d.7 May 1452; bur S.Agostinho, Santarem), dau of Pedro de Menezes, Cde de Villa Real; m.2nd 19 Sep 1472 Isabella of Portugal (1459-1521; above)

1d) Filippe, 1478 Duque de Guimaraes (6 Jul 1475-Castile autumn 1483)

2d) Margarida (ca 1477-Jun 1483)

3d) Jaime, 1483 Duque de Guimaraes. 1496 Duque de Bragança, etc, Admiral of the Fleet (1479-Villa Viçosa 20 Sep 1532; bur Villa Viçosa); m.1st 1502 Eleonora de Guzman (d.Villa Viçosa 2 Nov 1512; bur Monte Claros), dau of Juan Alfonso de Perez de Guzman, Duque de Medina Sidonia; m.2nd 1520 Joana de Mendoza (d.Villa Viçosa 1580; bur Chagas de Villa Viçosa), dau of Diego de Mendoza

1e) Teodosio, 1532 Duque de Bragança, etc, 1510 Duque de Barcellos (1510-Villa Viçosa 20 Sep 1563; bur Villa Viçosa); m.1st 25 Jun 1542 Isabel de Portugal-Castro (d.Lisbon 24 Aug 1558; bur Villa Viçosa), dau of Diniz de Portugal-Castro Cde de Lemos; m.2nd 4 Sep 1559 Brites de Lancastre (ca 1542-Leyria 12 Jun 1623), dau of Luiz de Lancastre

1f) João, 1563 Duque de Bragança, Duque de Barcellos, etc (ca 1544-Villa Viçosa 22 Feb 1583; bur S.Agostinho, Villa Viçosa); m.8 Dec 1563 Catarina of Portugal (1540-1614; above), dau of Duarte of Portugal, Duque de Guimaraes

1g) Maria (Villa Viçosa 27 Jan 1565-30 Apr 1592)

2g) Serafina (Villa Viçosa 20 May 1566-Rome6 Jan 1604; bur Sta.Ccilia, Rome); m.Villa Viçosa 6 Jan 1594 Juan Fernández-Pacheco, Duque de Escalona (d.5 May 1615)

3g) Teodosio, 1583 Duque de Bragança (Villa Viçosa 28 Apr 1568-d.insane at Villa Viçosa 29 Nov 1630; bur S.Paolo Hermite, Villa Viçosa); m.17 Jun 1603 Ana de Velasco (ca 1585-Villa Viçosa 7 Nov 1607; bur Chagas, Villa Viçosa), dau of Juan Fernández de Velasco, Duque de Frias

1h) João IV "the Lucky", regained the throne for his family and was King of Portugal and the Algarve from 1640, 1604 Duque de Barcellos, 1630 Duque de Bragança (Villa Viçosa 18 Mar 1604-Lisbon 6 Nov 1656; bur S.Vicente, Lisbon); m.by proxy in Madrid 10 Dec 1632 and in person at Elvas 12 Jan 1633 Luisa de Guzman, 1656/62 Regent of Portugal (Sanlucar de Barrameda 13 Oct 1613-Xabregas 27 Feb 1666), dau of Juan Manuel Perez de Guzman, Duque de Medina Sidonia

1i) Teodosio, Duque de Bragança, Pr of Brazil (Villa Viçosa 8 Feb 1634-Belem15 May 1653; bur S.Vicente de Fora)
